summary: Communications professional with more than 20 years of experience in the media and public information. Established a strong network of journalists, media outlets and civil society organisations in MENA region, Europe and the Gulf. Developed strong skills in communicating at the international level, in international organisations and expertise in international criminal justice.. Strong planning, managerial and interpersonal skills. Trained more than 100 communication and media interns and young professionals. Fluent in English, French and Arabic, and basic working knowledge of Spanish.

profile_positions.description:
As the only spokesperson of the special tribunal for Lebanon (STL), the first international tribunal with jurisdiction over terrorism and in a country in the MENA region, I encouraged and achieved a continued presence of the STL in the media, ensuring the “voice of STL” is always prompt, accurate, and direct and heard.
• Advised senior officials and principals of the four organs of the tribunal on media engagement and provided training to them prior to and during media engagement.
• Drafted and executed media strategies and action plans for major judicial milestones and decisions rendered by the STL, such as the judgment and sentencing in the main case before the tribunal, contempt case, new indictments and start of trial, as well as key proceedings currently before the tribunal.
• Successfully managed crisis communication with the media, at the time of an imminent threat of closure of the STL, due to lack of funds. Dealt and communicated with the international, regional and Lebanese media while protecting confidential, sensitive diplomatic and  ongoing political negotiations.
• Prepared and developed hundreds of pages of messages and anticipated questions from journalists to be ready to respond promptly and accurately during various judicial milestones. Following extensive internal coordination developed more than 80 documents with key messages, most of which were prepared at very short notice due to the nature of ongoing proceedings.
• Managed the public information and communications section (PICS), both in Beirut and The Hague in the absence of the chief, including management of staff, making strategic decisions in implementing the action plan during judicial milestones, and finalizing the budget of the section.
• Participated in external events and presented the work of the STL to various groups both in the Netherlands and in Lebanon.
profile_positions.title: Spokesperson

profile_positions.description:
• Established and successfully managed the STL outreach office for the first year and
• Conducted a media campaign to announce its establishment and promote the tribunal’s work.
• Following the recruitment of the chief of section assisted the head of outreach and legacy unit in developing and in implementing the overall communications strategy, drafting the budget, funding proposals, as well as reports to the European commission on project implementation
• Planned, organized, implemented and managed outreach activities and events. These activities ranged from short briefings to lectures as well as seminars, workshops, international conferences, and study visits of large groups from Lebanon to the Netherlands
• Maintained and expanded contacts with the tribunal’s key stakeholders and partners such as the bar associations in Lebanon, civil society, academic and legal communities, researchers, etc.
• Supervised the implementation of the yearly inter-university programme on international criminal law and procedure, implemented in cooperation between the STL, eleven universities in Lebanon and the T.M.C. Asser institute in The Hague. The programme included the selection process of students, coordination of the fourteen courses, final exam, graduation ceremony and two study visits to The Hague
• Held lectures and presentations on the work of the STL to the main target audiences in Lebanon and provided responses as appropriate
profile_positions.title: Outreach Officer

profile_positions.description:
• Managed the production of a daily 30 minutes news bulletin in French by supervising the editorial content, delegation of the reports to the team, planning, supervising the video editing and the reports, as well as selecting the daily news items to be broadcast,
• Made strategic decisions on the editorial lines of the bulletin, as well as in full respect of the Lebanese sensitive political and social characteristics, and in full responsibility and ethics when reporting a news item related to a particular conflict.
• Attended senior editorial meetings with the channel’s officials to determine and identify the areas of interest to the public and strategized the content of the bulletin to ensure increasing viewership
• Produced news reports for the bulletin on a daily basis
• Supervised the video editing of all stories to be aired, decided on image sequences responsibly
• Reported from conflict zones in south Lebanon as well as in Beirut (from 1998 to 2000) and during the 2006 conflict between Israel and Lebanon  
• Recruited and trained reporters and staff on a daily basis, implementing the best teamwork practices and maintained their motivation for the production of the news bulletin
profile_positions.title: Editor in Chief and Anchor, French Bulletin

profile_positions.description:
• Produced audio visual news reports from Beirut for the hourly news bulletins.                      
• Conducted live coverage including live interviews during breaking news such as terrorist attacks, explosions, and security incidents which occurred in Lebanon during this period.
• Featured in talk shows, providing in depth political analyses of a particular event and participated in debates live on television focused on the news developments.
profile_positions.title: Correspondent

profile_positions.description: • Directed and produced a documentary “La Porte du vent”. The 58 minutes film dealt with a controversial border area between Turkey and Syria and tackled the situation of families separated during six decades. Published articles in prominent French and Lebanese print media, such as Le Point and Le Nouvel Observateur and L’Orient le Jour. Co-produced a documentary “Jerba, l’appel de l’interieur”, funded Canal France international, a French state run television channel. The 30 minutes film was broadcast during the closing ceremony of the “first international TV festival” in Jerba, Tunisia.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Journalist

profile_positions.description: Assisted the Minister’s Communication Adviser in managing all internal and external communications tools. These included publications and guides for citizens and other ministries in Lebanon aimed at raising awareness on the necessity to reform public institutions.
profile_positions.title: Information Officer and Assistant Communication Officer
